name: APTSimulator
description: Windows Batch script that uses a set of tools and output files to make a system look as if it was compromised.

name: Atomic Red Team (ART)
description: Small and highly portable detection tests mapped to the MITRE ATT&CK Framework.

name: AutoTTP
description: Automated Tactics Techniques & Procedures. Re-running complex sequences manually for regression tests, product evaluations, generate data for researchers.

name: Blue Team Training Toolkit (BT3)
description: Software for defensive security training, which will bring your network analysis training sessions, incident response drills and red team engagements to a new level.

name: Caldera
description: Automated adversary emulation system that performs post-compromise adversarial behavior within Windows Enterprise networks. It generates plans during operation using a planning system and a pre-configured adversary model based on the Adversarial Tactics, Techniques & Common Knowledge (ATT&CK™) project.

name: DumpsterFire
description: Modular, menu-driven, cross-platform tool for building repeatable, time-delayed, distributed security events. Easily create custom event chains for Blue Team drills and sensor /   alert mapping. Red Teams can create decoy incidents, distractions, and lures to support and scale their operations.

name: Metta
description: Information security preparedness tool to do adversarial simulation.

name: Network Flight Simulator
description: Lightweight utility used to generate malicious network traffic and help security teams to evaluate security controls and network visibility.

name: Red Team Automation (RTA)
description: RTA provides a framework of scripts designed to allow blue teams to test their detection capabilities against malicious tradecraft, modeled after MITRE ATT&CK.

name: RedHunt-OS
description: Virtual machine for adversary emulation and threat hunting.

name: Belkasoft Evidence Center
description: The toolkit will quickly extract digital evidence from multiple sources by analyzing hard drives, drive images, memory dumps, iOS, Blackberry and Android backups, UFED, JTAG and chip-off dumps.

name: CimSweep
description: Suite of CIM/WMI-based tools that enable the ability to perform incident response and hunting operations remotely across all versions of Windows.

name: CIRTkit
description: CIRTKit is not just a collection of tools, but also a framework to aid in the ongoing unification of Incident Response and Forensics investigation processes.

name: Cyber Triage
description: Cyber Triage remotely collects and analyzes endpoint data to help determine if it is compromised.  It’s agentless approach and focus on ease of use and automation allows companies to respond without major infrastructure changes and without a team of forensics experts.  Its results are used to decide if the system should be erased or investigated further.

name: Doorman
description: osquery fleet manager that allows remote management of osquery configurations retrieved by nodes. It takes advantage of osquery's TLS configuration, logger, and distributed read/write endpoints, to give administrators visibility across a fleet of devices with minimal overhead and intrusiveness.

name: Falcon Orchestrator
description: Extendable Windows-based application that provides workflow automation, case management and security response functionality.

name: Flare
description: A fully customizable, Windows-based security distribution for malware analysis, incident response, penetration testing.

name: Fleetdm
description: State of the art host monitoring platform tailored for security experts. Leveraging Facebook's battle-tested osquery project, Fleetdm delivers continuous updates, features and fast answers to big questions.

name: GRR Rapid Response
description: Incident response framework focused on remote live forensics. It consists of a python agent (client) that is installed on target systems, and a python server infrastructure that can manage and talk to the agent. Besides the included Python API client, PowerGRR provides an API client library in PowerShell working on Windows, Linux and macOS for GRR automation and scripting.

name: IRIS
description: IRIS is a web collaborative platform for incident response analysts allowing to share investigations at a technical level.

name: Kuiper
description: Digital Forensics Investigation Platform

name: Limacharlie
description: Endpoint security platform composed of a collection of small projects all working together that gives you a cross-platform (Windows, OSX, Linux, Android and iOS) low-level environment for managing and pushing additional modules into memory to extend its functionality.

name: MozDef
description: Automates the security incident handling process and facilitate the real-time activities of incident handlers.

name: nightHawk
description: Application built for asynchronus forensic data presentation using ElasticSearch as the backend. It's designed to ingest Redline collections.

name: Open Computer Forensics Architecture
description: Another popular distributed open-source computer forensics framework. This framework was built on Linux platform and uses postgreSQL database for storing data.

name: osquery
description: Easily ask questions about your Linux and macOS infrastructure using a SQL-like query language; the provided incident-response pack helps you detect and respond to breaches.

name: Redline
description: Provides host investigative capabilities to users to find signs of malicious activity through memory and file analysis, and the development of a threat assessment profile.

name: The Sleuth Kit & Autopsy
description: Unix and Windows based tool which helps in forensic analysis of computers. It comes with various tools which helps in digital forensics. These tools help in analyzing disk images, performing in-depth analysis of file systems, and various other things.

name: TheHive
description: Scalable 3-in-1 open source and free solution designed to make life easier for SOCs, CSIRTs, CERTs and any information security practitioner dealing with security incidents that need to be investigated and acted upon swiftly.

name: Velociraptor
description: Endpoint visibility and collection tool

name: X-Ways Forensics
description: Forensics tool for Disk cloning and imaging. It can be used to find deleted files and disk analysis.

name: Zentral
description: Combines osquery's powerful endpoint inventory features with a flexible notification and action framework. This enables one to identify and react to changes on OS X and Linux clients.

name: Applied Incident Response
description: Steve Anson's book on Incident Response.

name: Crafting the InfoSec Playbook: Security Monitoring and Incident Response Master Plan
description: by Jeff Bollinger, Brandon Enright and Matthew Valites.

name: Digital Forensics and Incident Response: Incident response techniques and procedures to respond to modern cyber threats
description: by Gerard Johansen.

name: Introduction to DFIR
description: By Scott J. Roberts.

name: Incident Response & Computer Forensics, Third Edition
description: The definitive guide to incident response.

name: Intelligence-Driven Incident Response
description: By Scott J. Roberts, Rebekah Brown.

name: Operator Handbook: Red Team + OSINT + Blue Team Reference
description: Great reference for incident responders.

name: The Practice of Network Security Monitoring: Understanding Incident Detection and Response
description: Richard Bejtlich's book on IR.

name: Digital Forensics Discord Server
description: Community of 8,000+ working professionals from Law Enforcement, Private Sector, and Forensic Vendors. Additionally, plenty of students and hobbyists! Guide here.

name: SANS DFIR mailing list
description: Mailing list by SANS for DFIR.

name: Slack DFIR channel
description: Slack DFIR Communitiy channel - Signup here.

name: AccessData FTK Imager
description: Forensics tool whose main purpose is to preview recoverable data from a disk of any kind. FTK Imager can also acquire live memory and paging file on 32bit and 64bit systems.

name: Bitscout
description: Bitscout by Vitaly Kamluk helps you build your fully-trusted customizable LiveCD/LiveUSB image to be used for remote digital forensics (or perhaps any other task of your choice). It is meant to be transparent and monitorable by the owner of the system, forensically sound, customizable and compact.

name: GetData Forensic Imager
description: Windows based program that will acquire, convert, or verify a forensic image in one of the following common forensic file formats.

name: Guymager
description: Free forensic imager for media acquisition on Linux.

name: Magnet ACQUIRE
description: ACQUIRE by Magnet Forensics allows various types of disk acquisitions to be performed on Windows, Linux, and OS X as well as mobile operating systems.

name: artifactcollector
description: The artifactcollector project provides a software that collects forensic artifacts on systems.

name: bulk_extractor
description: Computer forensics tool that scans a disk image, a file, or a directory of files and extracts useful information without parsing the file system or file system structures. Because of ignoring the file system structure, the program distinguishes itself in terms of speed and thoroughness.

name: Cold Disk Quick Response
description: Streamlined list of parsers to quickly analyze a forensic image file (dd, E01, .vmdk, etc) and output nine reports.

name: CyLR
description: The CyLR tool collects forensic artifacts from hosts with NTFS file systems quickly, securely and minimizes impact to the host.

name: Forensic Artifacts
description: Digital Forensics Artifact Repository

name: ir-rescue
description: Windows Batch script and a Unix Bash script to comprehensively collect host forensic data during incident response.

name: Live Response Collection
description: Automated tool that collects volatile data from Windows, OSX, and *nix based operating systems.

name: Margarita Shotgun
description: Command line utility (that works with or without Amazon EC2 instances) to parallelize remote memory acquisition.

name: UAC
description: UAC (Unix-like Artifacts Collector) is a Live Response collection script for Incident Response that makes use of native binaries and tools to automate the collection of AIX, Android, ESXi, FreeBSD, Linux, macOS, NetBSD, NetScaler, OpenBSD and Solaris systems artifacts.

name: Catalyst
description: A free SOAR system that helps to automate alert handling and incident response processes.

name: CyberCPR
description: Community and commercial incident management tool with Need-to-Know built in to support GDPR compliance while handling sensitive incidents.

name: Cyphon
description: Cyphon eliminates the headaches of incident management by streamlining a multitude of related tasks through a single platform. It receives, processes and triages events to provide an all-encompassing solution for your analytic workflow — aggregating data, bundling and prioritizing alerts, and empowering analysts to investigate and document incidents.

name: CORTEX XSOAR
description: Paloalto security orchestration, automation and response platform with full Incident lifecycle management and many integrations to enhance automations.

name: DFTimewolf
description: A framework for orchestrating forensic collection, processing and data export.

name: DFIRTrack
description: Incident Response tracking application handling one or more incidents via cases and tasks with a lot of affected systems and artifacts.

name: Fast Incident Response (FIR)
description: Cybersecurity incident management platform designed with agility and speed in mind. It allows for easy creation, tracking, and reporting of cybersecurity incidents and is useful for CSIRTs, CERTs and SOCs alike.

name: RTIR
description: Request Tracker for Incident Response (RTIR) is the premier open source incident handling system targeted for computer security teams. We worked with over a dozen CERT and CSIRT teams around the world to help you handle the ever-increasing volume of incident reports. RTIR builds on all the features of Request Tracker.

name: Sandia Cyber Omni Tracker (SCOT)
description: Incident Response collaboration and knowledge capture tool focused on flexibility and ease of use. Our goal is to add value to the incident response process without burdening the user.

name: Shuffle
description: A general purpose security automation platform focused on accessibility.

name: threat_note
description: Lightweight investigation notebook that allows security researchers the ability to register and retrieve indicators related to their research.

name: Digital Forensics Artifact Knowledge Base
description: Digital Forensics Artifact Knowledge Base

name: Windows Events Attack Samples
description: Windows Events Attack Samples

name: Windows Registry Knowledge Base
description: Windows Registry Knowledge Base

name: The Appliance for Digital Investigation and Analysis (ADIA)
description: VMware-based appliance used for digital investigation and acquisition and is built entirely from public domain software. Among the tools contained in ADIA are Autopsy, the Sleuth Kit, the Digital Forensics Framework, log2timeline, Xplico, and Wireshark. Most of the system maintenance uses Webmin. It is designed for small-to-medium sized digital investigations and acquisitions. The appliance runs under Linux, Windows, and Mac OS. Both i386 (32-bit) and x86_64 (64-bit) versions are available.

name: Computer Aided Investigative Environment (CAINE)
description: Contains numerous tools that help investigators during their analysis, including forensic evidence collection.

name: CCF-VM
description: CyLR CDQR Forensics Virtual Machine (CCF-VM): An all-in-one solution to parsing collected data, making it easily searchable with built-in common searches, enable searching of single and multiple hosts simultaneously.

name: Digital Evidence & Forensics Toolkit (DEFT)
description: Linux distribution made for computer forensic evidence collection. It comes bundled with the Digital Advanced Response Toolkit (DART) for Windows. A light version of DEFT, called DEFT Zero, is also available, which is focused primarily on forensically sound evidence collection.

name: NST
description: Network Security Toolkit - Linux distribution that includes a vast collection of best-of-breed open source network security applications useful to the network security professional.

name: PALADIN
description: Modified Linux distribution to perform various forensics task in a forensically sound manner. It comes with many open source forensics tools included.

name: Security Onion
description: Special Linux distro aimed at network security monitoring featuring advanced analysis tools.

name: SANS Investigative Forensic Toolkit (SIFT) Workstation
description: Demonstrates that advanced incident response capabilities and deep dive digital forensic techniques to intrusions can be accomplished using cutting-edge open-source tools that are freely available and frequently updated.

name: FastIR Collector Linux
description: FastIR for Linux collects different artifacts on live Linux and records the results in CSV files.

name: AppCompatProcessor
description: AppCompatProcessor has been designed to extract additional value from enterprise-wide AppCompat / AmCache data beyond the classic stacking and grepping techniques.

name: APT Hunter
description: APT-Hunter is Threat Hunting tool for windows event logs.

name: Chainsaw
description: Chainsaw provides a powerful ‘first-response’ capability to quickly identify threats within Windows event logs.

name: Event Log Explorer
description: Tool developed to quickly analyze log files and other data.

name: Event Log Observer
description: View, analyze and monitor events recorded in Microsoft Windows event logs with this GUI tool.

name: Kaspersky CyberTrace
description: Threat intelligence fusion and analysis tool that integrates threat data feeds with SIEM solutions. Users can immediately leverage threat intelligence for security monitoring and incident report (IR) activities in the workflow of their existing security operations.

name: Log Parser Lizard
description: Execute SQL queries against structured log data: server logs, Windows Events, file system, Active Directory, log4net logs, comma/tab separated text, XML or JSON files. Also provides a GUI to Microsoft LogParser 2.2 with powerful UI elements: syntax editor, data grid, chart, pivot table, dashboard, query manager and more.

name: Lorg
description: Tool for advanced HTTPD logfile security analysis and forensics.

name: Logdissect
description: CLI utility and Python API for analyzing log files and other data.

name: LogonTracer
description: Tool to investigate malicious Windows logon by visualizing and analyzing Windows event log.

name: Sigma
description: Generic signature format for SIEM systems already containing an extensive ruleset.

name: StreamAlert
description: Serverless, real-time log data analysis framework, capable of ingesting custom data sources and triggering alerts using user-defined logic.

name: SysmonSearch
description: SysmonSearch makes Windows event log analysis more effective and less time consuming by aggregation of event logs.

name: Zircolite
description: A standalone and fast SIGMA-based detection tool for EVTX or JSON.

name: AVML
description: A portable volatile memory acquisition tool for Linux.

name: Evolve
description: Web interface for the Volatility Memory Forensics Framework.

name: inVtero.net
description: Advanced memory analysis for Windows x64 with nested hypervisor support.

name: LiME
description: Loadable Kernel Module (LKM), which allows the acquisition of volatile memory from Linux and Linux-based devices, formerly called DMD.

name: MalConfScan
description: MalConfScan is a Volatility plugin extracts configuration data of known malware. Volatility is an open-source memory forensics framework for incident response and malware analysis. This tool searches for malware in memory images and dumps configuration data. In addition, this tool has a function to list strings to which malicious code refers.

name: Memoryze
description: Free memory forensic software that helps incident responders find evil in live memory. Memoryze can acquire and/or analyze memory images, and on live systems, can include the paging file in its analysis.

name: Memoryze for Mac
description: Memoryze for Mac is Memoryze but then for Macs. A lower number of features, however.

name: Orochi
description: Orochi is an open source framework for collaborative forensic memory dump analysis.

name: Rekall
description: Open source tool (and library) for the extraction of digital artifacts from volatile memory (RAM) samples.

name: Responder PRO
description: Responder PRO is the industry standard physical memory and automated malware analysis solution.

name: Volatility
description: Advanced memory forensics framework.

name: Volatility 3
description: The volatile memory extraction framework (successor of Volatility)

name: VolatilityBot
description: Automation tool for researchers cuts all the guesswork and manual tasks out of the binary extraction phase, or to help the investigator in the first steps of performing a memory analysis investigation.

name: VolDiff
description: Malware Memory Footprint Analysis based on Volatility.

name: WindowsSCOPE
description: Memory forensics and reverse engineering tool used for analyzing volatile memory offering the capability of analyzing the Windows kernel, drivers, DLLs, and virtual and physical memory.

name: Belkasoft Live RAM Capturer
description: Tiny free forensic tool to reliably extract the entire content of the computer’s volatile memory – even if protected by an active anti-debugging or anti-dumping system.

name: Linux Memory Grabber
description: Script for dumping Linux memory and creating Volatility profiles.

name: Magnet RAM Capture
description: Free imaging tool designed to capture the physical memory of a suspect’s computer. Supports recent versions of Windows.

name: OSForensics
description: Tool to acquire live memory on 32-bit and 64-bit systems. A dump of an individual process’s memory space or physical memory dump can be done.

name: Knockknock
description: Displays persistent items(scripts, commands, binaries, etc.) that are set to execute automatically on OSX.

name: macOS Artifact Parsing Tool (mac_apt)
description: Plugin based forensics framework for quick mac triage that works on live machines, disk images or individual artifact files.

name: OSX Auditor
description: Free Mac OS X computer forensics tool.

name: OSX Collector
description: OSX Auditor offshoot for live response.

name: The ESF Playground
description: A tool to view the events in Apple Endpoint Security Framework (ESF) in real time.

name: Awesome Event IDs
description: Collection of Event ID resources useful for Digital Forensics and Incident Response.

name: Awesome Forensics
description: A curated list of awesome forensic analysis tools and resources.

name: Didier Stevens Suite
description: Tool collection

name: Eric Zimmerman Tools
description: An updated list of forensic tools created by Eric Zimmerman, an instructor for SANS institute.

name: List of various Security APIs
description: Collective list of public JSON APIs for use in security.

name: Cortex
description: Cortex allows you to analyze observables such as IP and email addresses, URLs, domain names, files or hashes one by one or in bulk mode using a Web interface. Analysts can also automate these operations using its REST API.

name: Crits
description: Web-based tool which combines an analytic engine with a cyber threat database.

name: Diffy
description: DFIR tool developed by Netflix's SIRT that allows an investigator to quickly scope a compromise across cloud instances (Linux instances on AWS, currently) during an incident and efficiently triaging those instances for followup actions by showing differences against a baseline.

name: domfind
description: Python DNS crawler for finding identical domain names under different TLDs.

name: Fileintel
description: Pull intelligence per file hash.

name: HELK
description: Threat Hunting platform.

name: Hindsight
description: Internet history forensics for Google Chrome/Chromium.

name: Hostintel
description: Pull intelligence per host.

name: imagemounter
description: Command line utility and Python package to ease the (un)mounting of forensic disk images.

name: Kansa
description: Modular incident response framework in PowerShell.

name: MFT Browser
description: MFT directory tree reconstruction & record info.

name: Munin
description: Online hash checker for VirusTotal and other services.

name: PowerSponse
description: PowerSponse is a PowerShell module focused on targeted containment and remediation during security incident response.

name: PyaraScanner
description: Very simple multi-threaded many-rules to many-files YARA scanning Python script for malware zoos and IR.

name: rastrea2r
description: Allows one to scan disks and memory for IOCs using YARA on Windows, Linux and OS X.

name: RaQet
description: Unconventional remote acquisition and triaging tool that allows triage a disk of a remote computer (client) that is restarted with a purposely built forensic operating system.

name: Raccine
description: A Simple Ransomware Protection

name: Stalk
description: Collect forensic data about MySQL when problems occur.

name: Scout2
description: Security tool that lets Amazon Web Services administrators assess their environment's security posture.

name: Stenographer
description: Packet capture solution which aims to quickly spool all packets to disk, then provide simple, fast access to subsets of those packets. It stores as much history as it possible, managing disk usage, and deleting when disk limits are hit. It's ideal for capturing the traffic just before and during an incident, without the need explicit need to store all of the network traffic.

name: sqhunter
description: Threat hunter based on osquery and Salt Open (SaltStack) that can issue ad-hoc or distributed queries without the need for osquery's tls plugin. sqhunter allows you to query open network sockets and check them against threat intelligence sources.

name: sysmon-config
description: Sysmon configuration file template with default high-quality event tracing

name: sysmon-modular
description: A repository of sysmon configuration modules

name: traceroute-circl
description: Extended traceroute to support the activities of CSIRT (or CERT) operators. Usually CSIRT team have to handle incidents based on IP addresses received. Created by Computer Emergency Response Center Luxembourg.

name: X-Ray 2.0
description: Windows utility (poorly maintained or no longer maintained) to submit virus samples to AV vendors.

name: AWS Incident Response Runbook Samples
description: AWS IR Runbook Samples meant to be customized per each entity using them. The three samples are: "DoS or DDoS attack", "credential leakage", and "unintended access to an Amazon S3 bucket".

name: Counteractive Playbooks
description: Counteractive PLaybooks collection.

name: GuardSIght Playbook Battle Cards
description: A collection of Cyber Incident Response Playbook Battle Cards

name: IRM
description: Incident Response Methodologies by CERT Societe Generale.

name: IR Workflow Gallery
description: Different generic incident response workflows, e.g. for malware outbreak, data theft, unauthorized access,... Every workflow consists of seven steps: prepare, detect, analyze, contain, eradicate, recover, post-incident handling. The workflows are online available or for download.

name: PagerDuty Incident Response Documentation
description: Documents that describe parts of the PagerDuty Incident Response process. It provides information not only on preparing for an incident, but also what to do during and after. Source is available on GitHub.

name: Phantom Community Playbooks
description: Phantom Community Playbooks for Splunk but also customizable for other use.

name: ThreatHunter-Playbook
description: Playbook to aid the development of techniques and hypothesis for hunting campaigns.

name: Microsoft ProcDump
description: Dumps any running Win32 processes memory image on the fly.

name: PMDump
description: Tool that lets you dump the memory contents of a process to a file without stopping the process.

name: AMAaaS
description: Android Malware Analysis as a Service, executed in a native Android environment.

name: Any Run
description: Interactive online malware analysis service for dynamic and static research of most types of threats using any environment.

name: CAPEv2
description: Malware Configuration And Payload Extraction.

name: Cuckoo
description: Open Source Highly configurable sandboxing tool.

name: Cuckoo-modified
description: Heavily modified Cuckoo fork developed by community.

name: Cuckoo-modified-api
description: Python library to control a cuckoo-modified sandbox.

name: Cutter
description: Reverse engineering platform powered by Radare2.

name: Ghidra
description: Software Reverse Engineering Framework.

name: Hybrid-Analysis
description: Free powerful online sandbox by CrowdStrike.

name: Intezer
description: Intezer Analyze dives into Windows binaries to detect micro-code similarities to known threats, in order to provide accurate yet easy-to-understand results.

name: Joe Sandbox (Community)
description: Joe Sandbox detects and analyzes potential malicious files and URLs on Windows, Android, Mac OS, Linux, and iOS for suspicious activities; providing comprehensive and detailed analysis reports.

name: Mastiff
description: Static analysis framework that automates the process of extracting key characteristics from a number of different file formats.

name: Metadefender Cloud
description: Free threat intelligence platform providing multiscanning, data sanitization and vulnerability assessment of files.

name: Radare2
description: Reverse engineering framework and command-line toolset.

name: Reverse.IT
description: Alternative domain for the Hybrid-Analysis tool provided by CrowdStrike.

name: Rizin
description: UNIX-like reverse engineering framework and command-line toolset

name: StringSifter
description: A machine learning tool that ranks strings based on their relevance for malware analysis.

name: Valkyrie Comodo
description: Valkyrie uses run-time behavior and hundreds of features from a file to perform analysis.

name: Viper
description: Python based binary analysis and management framework, that works well with Cuckoo and YARA.

name: Virustotal
description: Free online service that analyzes files and URLs enabling the identification of viruses, worms, trojans and other kinds of malicious content detected by antivirus engines and website scanners.

name: Visualize_Logs
description: Open source visualization library and command line tools for logs (Cuckoo, Procmon, more to come).

name: Yomi
description: Free MultiSandbox managed and hosted by Yoroi.

name: Fenrir
description: Simple IOC scanner. It allows scanning any Linux/Unix/OSX system for IOCs in plain bash. Created by the creators of THOR and LOKI.

name: LOKI
description: Free IR scanner for scanning endpoint with yara rules and other indicators(IOCs).

name: Spyre
description: Simple YARA-based IOC scanner written in Go

name: Aurora Incident Response
description: Platform developed to build easily a detailed timeline of an incident.

name: Highlighter
description: Free Tool available from Fire/Mandiant that will depict log/text file that can highlight areas on the graphic, that corresponded to a key word or phrase. Good for time lining an infection and what was done post compromise.

name: Morgue
description: PHP Web app by Etsy for managing postmortems.

name: Plaso
description: a Python-based backend engine for the tool log2timeline.

name: Timesketch
description: Open source tool for collaborative forensic timeline analysis.

name: The Future of Incident Response
description: Presented by Bruce Schneier at OWASP AppSecUSA 2015.

name: AChoir
description: Framework/scripting tool to standardize and simplify the process of scripting live acquisition utilities for Windows.

name: Crowd Response
description: Lightweight Windows console application designed to aid in the gathering of system information for incident response and security engagements. It features numerous modules and output formats.

name: DFIR ORC
description: DFIR ORC is a collection of specialized tools dedicated to reliably parse and collect critical artifacts such as the MFT, registry hives or event logs. DFIR ORC collects data, but does not analyze it: it is not meant to triage machines. It provides a forensically relevant snapshot of machines running Microsoft Windows. The code can be found on GitHub.

name: FastIR Collector
description: Tool that collects different artifacts on live Windows systems and records the results in csv files. With the analyses of these artifacts, an early compromise can be detected.

name: Fibratus
description: Tool for exploration and tracing of the Windows kernel.

name: Hoarder
description: Collecting the most valuable artifacts for forensics or incident response investigations.

name: IREC
description: All-in-one IR Evidence Collector which captures RAM Image, $MFT, EventLogs, WMI Scripts, Registry Hives, System Restore Points and much more. It is FREE, lightning fast and easy to use.

name: Invoke-LiveResponse
description: Invoke-LiveResponse is a live response tool for targeted collection.

name: IOC Finder
description: Free tool from Mandiant for collecting host system data and reporting the presence of Indicators of Compromise (IOCs). Support for Windows only. No longer maintained. Only fully supported up to Windows 7 / Windows Server 2008 R2.

name: IRTriage
description: Incident Response Triage - Windows Evidence Collection for Forensic Analysis.

name: KAPE
description: Kroll Artifact Parser and Extractor (KAPE) by Eric Zimmerman. A triage tool that finds the most prevalent digital artifacts and then parses them quickly. Great and thorough when time is of the essence.

name: LOKI
description: Free IR scanner for scanning endpoint with yara rules and other indicators(IOCs).

name: MEERKAT
description: PowerShell-based triage and threat hunting for Windows.

name: Panorama
description: Fast incident overview on live Windows systems.

name: PowerForensics
description: Live disk forensics platform, using PowerShell.

name: PSRecon
description: PSRecon gathers data from a remote Windows host using PowerShell (v2 or later), organizes the data into folders, hashes all extracted data, hashes PowerShell and various system properties, and sends the data off to the security team. The data can be pushed to a share, sent over email, or retained locally.

name: RegRipper
description: Open source tool, written in Perl, for extracting/parsing information (keys, values, data) from the Registry and presenting it for analysis.
